title: What old TV show had the best collection of people who would later become big stars? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m always looking for people who later became big stars. Surprisingly, the one where I found future stars was Cannon? I know just your average private eye show from the 70’s. But one show had a very young Martin Sheen. Pretty good. And in that episode a “Dan Travanti” who later billed himself more augustly as Daniel J. Travanti when he starred in Hill Street Blues. There was an Alfred Hitchcock episode where a pharmacy makes a fatal mistake — it is Hitchcock, after all. The young delivery man was Robert Redford. But in watching a lot of Hitchcock shows I never saw two unknowns who became famous in a single episode. I don’t know why more bit-part people don’t end up becoming famous.

TV stars? If that’s the criteria, then the Mary Tyler Moore Show. MTM- 2 legendary sitcoms, Oscer nominee for Ordinary People ( a stunning change of pace) Ed Asner- multiple Emmy winner, not just for MTM but Roots and Lou Grant. He was in Elf and Up, among other movies Cloris Leachman - Oscar and Emmy winner Valerie Harper- Emmy winner, had 2 subsequent shows Gavin MacLeod- went on to captain The Love Boat Ted Knight - had a successful sitcom of his own until his death Betty White - did she do much after this?
